utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay! Listen, I’m gonna be moving out so you will be in charge of paying the rent.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Right! And when is that due?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: First of the month.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And that’s every month?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, just the months you actually want to live here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ahhh.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, here is the phone bill.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh my God!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: That’s our phone number. Now look, I know I kinda sprung this whole me moving out on thing, so why don’t I just—why don’t I just cover you for a while?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No-no! No way! Joey Tribbiani does not take charity…anymore.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s not charity, Joe…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No! Forget it! Okay—I mean thanks, but I’m done taking money from you. All right, I can take of myself. Now, what’s next? Come on.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay uh, here’s the electric bill.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This is how much we pay for electric?!!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So, we’ll do the rest of the bills later then?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So is Joey going to have to give up the apartment?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, I hope not! I tried to offer him some money, but he wouldn’t take it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, how much do you think he needs?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I figure that $1,500 would cover him for a few months, y’know? But I have to trick him into taking it so I won’t hurt his pride.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why don’t you hire him as an actor? You could have him dress up and put on little skits. Whatever you want.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well that would help the pride thing.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! Wow! You look great! Wanna move in with me tomorrow?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay! So, what do you girls have planned for tonight?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, instead of being sad that tonight is my last night together with Rachel we thought we’d go out to dinner and celebrate the fact that Rachel is moving in with Phoebe.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And also, my birthday.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s not your birthday.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What a mean thing to say! I would never tell you it’s not your birthday!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! So you guys have anything planned for the big last night?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, instead of just hanging out, we figure we’d do nothing.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-whoa, Knicks season opener tonight. I thought maybe you guys would come over and watch it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know Ross, not if you’re gonna talk about how you gave up a career in basketball to become a paleontologist.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I did give up a career in basketball to become a paleontologist!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Pheebs, I was wondering…

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re not dressed yet?! We’re supposed to start having fun in 15 minutes!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well and clearly not a minute sooner.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rachel, you are packed though right, I mean please tell me that you’re packed.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Of course I packed! Monica relax! I just wanted to ask Phoebe her opinion on what I should wear tonight.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: My God, I can’t get a minute of peace around this place.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh my God! Monica’s just gonna kill you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, I know.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, what you’re wearing is fine for that.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rachel, I need to borrow—You’re not packed!!!! You’re not packed even a little bit!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Surprise!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, no don’t get mad because look—this is what happened. So I-I started packing, then I realized, "What am I doing? I am lousy at packing!" Right? But you love packing! So, as a gift to you, on our last night, ta-da!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’ll be coordinator! Oh my God! I’m so sorry, I didn’t get you anything! Okay, look everybody has to help! Okay? You can help, can’t you Phoebe?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I have plans.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re plans were with us.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s right.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, Chandler can make boxes, Ross can wrap, and Joey can lift things. Now Phoebe, go tell the guys they have to help out!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay! Oh my God, thank you!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hurry! Monica’s gonna make you pack! She’s got jobs for everyone! Now, it’s too late for me, but save your selves!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay! The movers will be here in 11 hours. Rachel has not packed. Now, everybody has to help! Chandler, we’re gonna start with…

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh nope, I-I have plans with Joey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I thought you said you were going to do nothing.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, but for the last time.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay fine, now Ross…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, but-but I can’t do it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Why not?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’ve got Ben.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Because, because I’ve got Ben.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s almost 8 o’clock, it’s almost past his bedtime. Where-where is he?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He’s at a dinner party.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Is he really coming? Because I can see right into your apartment!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Of course he is! What, do you think I’d just use my son as-as an excuse? What kind of father do you think I am?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: All right, sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I gotta go make a fake Ben.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Here it is! Our last pizzas together as roommates.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, I wish I’d know you were going to do that, I ordered Chinese.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh that’s okay. Hey, actually in a way it’s kinda nice. Me, bringing the food of my ancestors, you, the food of yours!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Say, Joe, I had a strange idea of what we could do for our last night. What do you say we play a little uh, foosball for money?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What, are you crazy? You haven’t beaten me once since my injury plagued ’97 season. It would be easier if you just give me your money.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes it would. What do you say to $50?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, you’re on.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, let’s play! The big game, Italy vs. China, apparently.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ohhhhhh, look it’s the roller blades.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh God!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You remember when we got these?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I guess you weren’t there.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You guys, we said we were gonna have fun! Come on, hey, remember the time… You don’t remember?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m sorry Pheebs, I guess I’m just really said that I’m leaving.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m gonna miss you so much.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, this doesn’t have to be so sad though. Y’know? Maybe instead of just thinking about how much you’re gonna miss each other, you should like think of the things you’re not gonna miss.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don’t think there’s anything.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Come on, there’s gotta be something.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nope, she’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I have one.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Good! Great! You can go first.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Uh well, I guess I’m not gonna miss the fact that you’re never allowed to move the phone pen.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Good that’s a good one. Okay, Monica, anything? Y’know? Does Rachel move the phone pen?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Aw, sometimes. Always, actually.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, good. There you go. Doesn’t anyone feel better?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Not just the phone pen. I never get my messages.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You get your messages!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, well I don’t think it really counts if you have to read them off the back of your hand after you fall asleep on the couch.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So-so, you missed a message from who? Chandler or your mom? Or Chandler? Or your mom?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Great! It worked! No one’s sad.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes! I win again! Ha-ha! That’s like 500 bucks you owe me! Whoo-ho-hoo! $500 that is a loooot of electricity! Whoo-ho-ho! I gotta buy some food.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, give me a chance to win my money back. Okay? Sudden death, one goal, $1,000.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You serious?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yes!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, get ready to owe me!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, here we go. Ready?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No! No! No! No——one can beat me.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: See? Now, that’s why only the little fake men are supposed to do all the kicking.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hello? Oh, hi Ross! See? Other people call me!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, your brother. Score!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, I’m just over here with Ben. I thought we’d say hi.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, put him on!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ben, say hi to Aunt Monica. Oh, I guess he doesn’t feel like talking right now. He’s smiling though! Okay, talk to you later.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I think it was better when you guys were sad. Hey, uh, remember the roller blades?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You know what else I’m not gonna miss? "I’m Monica. I wash the toilet 17 times a day. Even if people are on it!"

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: "Hi I’m Rachel, is my sweater too tight? No? Oh, I’d better wash it and shrink it!"

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: "I’m Monica, I don’t get phone messages from interesting people. Ever!"

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey! I call her!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: "Oh my God, I love Ross! I hate Ross! I love Ross! I hate Ross!"

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: "Oh my God, I can’t find a boyfriend! So I guess I’ll just stumble across the hall and sleep with the first guy I find in there!"

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, we should get a move on if we wanna make those dinner reservations.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Still broken?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: This sucks man! The last night you’re here and I lose the two most important things in my life, the foosball table and $500.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, there are other ways of winning back your money, how about a little uh, a little Blackjack?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nah, not my game.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, uh, how about, how about—y’know what? We could play a new game. A new game, it’s fun.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, what’s it called?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Cups.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know how to play Cups.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’ll teach ya! Come on, come on, it’s really easy and really, really fun.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay, here you go. I have two queens, what do you have?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: A two and a five.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ho-ho, you win! 50 dollars!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh yeah! Okay, let’s play again. What do you got?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: A four and a nine.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’re kidding right?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No. Why?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well that’s a full cup!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Damn! I am good at Cups!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m not talking to her!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, one of you has to take the first step! And it should be you, because she’s the one who’s leaving. It’s harder for her!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, maybe you’re right—She made fun of my phone pen!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know, I took it hard too.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Listen Rachel, I feel really bad about—What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m unpacking!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m not moving! Is that picture straight?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It needs to go about 20 blocks to the left!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, y’know what? You’re the one who wants to make this big change and move in with Chandler! You should be the one to go! Why should I have to leave?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Because it’s my apartment!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well it’s mine too! What else you got?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How about, you’re moving!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look! This is ridiculous. We should be packing you!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey, how are you guys doing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Great! Monica’s moving!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I am not!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh really?! Then how come all your stuff is in this box?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, you guys. You guys I think I know what’s going on here. Okay, you guys… STOP!! I know that, I know that you’re acting mad because you think that it’ll make it easier to leave. But deep down you’re still really sad. Deep-deep down.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No Phoebe I am mad!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, deep-deep-deep down!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m just mad!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Then keep running.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You win.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, what did you have?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter because nothing beats a three and a six. That my friend is D-Cup. Okay, now much have you won so far?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, wow, 700.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Not 700 exactly?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Double it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well you see in Cups, once you get $700, you have to double it.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, I didn’t make up the rules. Now, after you receive the doubling bonus, you get uh, one card. Now that one card could be worth $100 bringing your total to 1,500. Don’t get to excited because that’s not gonna happen unless you get—No way!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, this is the last box of your clothes. I’m just gonna label it, "What were you thinking?"

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Funny, because I was just gonna go across the hall and write that on Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey you guys, I don’t mean to make things worse, but umm, I don’t want to live with Rachel anymore.

utterance.speaker: Monica and Rachel
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: You’re just so mean to each other! And I don’t want to end up like that with Rachel. I still like you!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, Phoebe that’s fine because I’m not moving.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-whoa, Phoebe you gotta take her! Y’know I-I-I said some really bad stuff about her, but y’know Rachel has some good qualities that make her a good roommate.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh really? Like what Monica?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know she has 147,000 pairs of boots…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh yeah, good start Mon.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She lets you borrow them.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah and you stretch ‘em out with your big old clown feet.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Do you wanna live outside?! Because it’s gettin’ cold! She gets tons of catalogs and umm, she’ll fold down the pages of the things she thinks that I’d like.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What else?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: When I take a shower, she leaves me little notes on the mirror.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, I do. I-I do, do that.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That’s nice. I like having things to read in the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: When I fall asleep on the couch after reading, she covers me over with a blanket.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well y’know, I don’t want you to be cold.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And when I told her that I was gonna be moving in with Chandler, she was really supportive. You were so great. You made it so easy. And now you have to leave. And I have to live with a boy!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, it’s gonna be fine.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay Rachel, I can’t wait to live with you! And you know what we should do? Bring Monica and then we could all live there together! We’ll have so much fun!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: But honey, I think she’s moving in with Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh that’s right. You’re still set on that?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Kinda. Oh my God!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hello? Hey Mon, how’s the packing going? Ben? He’s fine. Yeah, he’s right—Oh my God! Get your head of your shirt there son! What? Yeah, it’s a pumpkin. I’ll come pack.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ross and I were helping the girls pack, took a little break, I lost $1,500 to him in Cups!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wh-How did you lose at Cups?!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: The same way you lost. I started out with a King and a Queen, bamn! Ross gets a 2 and a 3. Then I get a Jack and a King, boom! Ross gets a 4 and a 5! Ross was getting the Cup card, the D-Cup, the Sittin’ Down Bonus! Meanwhile, I didn’t even get half a cup! Nothin’!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh man!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And he never played before either! Y’know what I think? I think beginner’s luck, very important in Cups.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, let’s play one more hand! One more!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no, no more! I cannot lose another dime! I’m serious this time! In-in fact, look, there’s a—I wanna give you something. And let me give it too you know before I pawn it for Cups money. Now, I want you to have the big white dog as a kinda of a, y’know, thank you for being such a great roommate.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I can’t take the big white dog! You love it!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: It’s him, not it!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No, but wait—what if I bought it from you, y’know? And your nice gesture would be giving it to me at a reasonable price, say $1,500?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Wait a second, I see what you’re trying to do here! You-you’re trying to give me money again!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: When did I try to give you money?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Over there! Before, with the bills! You tried to give some charity, I said "No," you dropped it. Okay? Then we had a nice last night together, we had some fun, we gambled, nobody tried to give anybody any money! Now out of the blue, you start with the charity thing again!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m just trying to help you out! Okay? I wanna make sure that you’re okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I will be okay! Look Chandler, you gotta get it out of your head that I can’t take care of myself. Okay? Look, I’m not gonna miss you helping me out with money. The only thing that I’m gonna miss…is you. And now the dog.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey. Call me when you get there. Okay?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m really gonna miss you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh! I have your key. Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh God! This is silly, I’m gonna see you in a couple of hours!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Bye house!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Bye Mon.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: She really left.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: No problem roomie.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Can I ask you a question?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sure!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What the hell is that dog doing here?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I invented the game of Cups as a way to give Joey money.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And now you want that money back.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Chandler, what kind of an idiot do you take me for?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s not a real game! I made it up!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m sorry you lost your money, but I won it fair and square.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: At a fake game!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Now, if you wanna try to make some of it back, I’d be glad to play you for it. But I should warn you, I am very good at Cups.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay! Now I assume the Saucer card came up when you played last.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hmm, let’s see if it comes up this time.
